function.name: arrayslice
function.help:
arraySlice returns a part of the original array, set by offset and length.
If offset is positive, the sequence begins with this offset taken from the beginning of the array. if offset is negative or 0 the offset starts with elements taken from before the end of the array.
If length is positive, the returned array is of this length. If length is negative, the returned array contains all values from offset to length elements before the end of the original array. If length is not specified, the returned array contains all elements starting from offset to the end of the original array.
Example: <cfscript> input = array("a", "b", "c", "d", "e");
dump(arraySlice(input, 3)); // returns "c", "d", und "e" dump(arraySlice(input, 3, -1)); // returns "c", "d" dump(arraySlice(input, -1, 1)); // returns "d" dump(arraySlice(input, 0, 1)); // returns "f" dump(arraySlice(input, 1, 1)); // returns "a" </cfscript>

parameter.name: offset
parameter.help: If positive, the sequence is taken from the start. If negative, or zero, the sequence is taken from the end.

parameter.name: length
parameter.help: If not specified, length is all elements from the offset to the end.
